result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy C Pease was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
If the Defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of extended supervision shall be the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

No driving without a valid license. No drugs without a proper prescription. No alcohol. No contact with Maria Bailey-Pease.
----------------------------

Other counseling as deemed appropriate by Agent. Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
----------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy C Pease in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have a plea agreement.  Defendant enters Guilty plea to Count #1 of the Amended Complaint; Court adopts the joint agreement of the parties and sentences the Defendant.  Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 15CF68 AND 15GF349
DEFENDANT WILL RESIDE AT COMFORT SUITES IN DELAVAN.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH M.G.B.P.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
15-1647 AND 15-1648

Defendant Timothy C Pease in court, in custody with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Stephen Michael Govin appeared.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant authorized but stayed until 04-30-2015 at 1:15 p.m.  Minutes filed.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
